etymologies: mid 17th century: from French céleri, from Italian dialect selleri, based on Greek selinon ‘parsley’

definitions: a cultivated plant of the parsley family, with closely packed succulent leafstalks that are eaten raw or cooked.

notes.text: Apium graveolens variety dulce, family Umbelliferae

shortDefinitions: cultivated plant of parsley family, with closely packed succulent leaf stalks which are used as salad
